Package ure.terrain

Terrain represents an instance of a terrain type in a Cell of an Area. The terrain affects movement, light, and other activities in the Cell. The base TerrainI should not be subclassed to a new base class if you want to use the supplied Terrain subtypes. To modify behavior of a URE base class, see the documentation on Decorators.
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    UTerrain
    UTerrain defines all the public methods of terrain.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Blank
    A basic terrain which does nothing unusual.
    Door
    Doors can be opened by walking into them, closed by interaction, and block movement and light when closed.
    Lava
    Lava does damage to things that move into it.
    Pit
    Pits allow movement only into an adjacent pit cell.
    Stairs
    Stairs is any area-transition terrain, be it a cave mouth, building entrance, or actual stairs.
    TerrainDeco
    TerrainDeco implements a transparent handoff to its component terrain for all UTerrain methods.
    TerrainDeserializer  
    TerrainI
    A real serializable instance of a terrain which exists in a single cell.
    UTerrainCzar
    Load and manage all the terrain types and dole them out as needed.
    Water
    Water has a pretty animation.
